name: WorldScannerBuilder
description: The `WorldScannerBuilder` class is a powerful World Interaction builder in JSMacros that provides a fluent API for creating custom world scanners. It allows you to build complex filters to find specific blocks and block states in the Minecraft world efficiently using native Java functions.
overview:
This builder is particularly useful for JavaScript and other languages that don't support multithreading natively, as it enables parallel processing of world scans that would otherwise run sequentially. The builder supports both string-based filters (for simple matching) and method-based filters (for complex logic).

The WorldScannerBuilder uses a fluent builder pattern with two main filter categories:

1. **Block Filters** - Filter based on block properties and methods
2. **Block State Filters** - Filter based on block state properties and methods

Each filter starts with a "with" command (like `withBlockFilter()` or `withStateFilter()`) and can be combined using "and", "or", "xor" commands. The "not" command negates the entire filter.

methods.name: withBlockFilter
methods.description: Starts a new block filter using a method from `BlockHelper`.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockHelper` to use for filtering.

examples:
// Filter blocks by their ID method
builder.withBlockFilter("getId");

methods.name: andBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block filter with AND logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockHelper` to use for filtering.

methods.name: orBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block filter with OR logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockHelper` to use for filtering.

methods.name: withStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Starts a new string-based block filter for simple text matching.

methods.name: andStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block filter with AND logic.

methods.name: orStringBlockFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block filter with OR logic.

methods.name: withStateFilter
methods.description: Starts a new block state filter using a method from `BlockStateHelper`.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockStateHelper` to use for filtering.

examples:
// Filter by block state opacity
builder.withStateFilter("getOpacity");

methods.name: andStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block state filter with AND logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockStateHelper` to use for filtering.

methods.name: orStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new block state filter with OR logic.

parameters.name: method
parameters.description: The name of the method from `BlockStateHelper` to use for filtering.

methods.name: notStateFilter
methods.description: Negates the current block state filter.

methods.name: withStringStateFilter
methods.description: Starts a new string-based block state filter.

methods.name: andStringStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block state filter with AND logic.

methods.name: orStringStateFilter
methods.description: Adds a new string block state filter with OR logic.

methods.name: is
methods.description: Applies a condition to the previously defined filter. This advanced version allows passing arguments to the underlying BlockHelper/BlockStateHelper method (methodArgs) and specifying the filter comparison logic (filterArgs). Note that simpler forms like `is(value)` or `is(operator, value)` are also commonly used, where `methodArgs` is implicitly empty and `filterArgs` handles the value/operator.

parameters.name: methodArgs
parameters.description: Optional arguments to pass to the BlockHelper or BlockStateHelper method that was previously set. Can be `null` or an empty array if not needed.

parameters.name: filterArgs
parameters.description: Arguments to define the filter condition itself. This can be a single value (e.g., `true`, `5`) or an array for more complex comparisons (e.g., `['>', 0]`, `['EQUALS', 'minecraft:stone']`).

examples:
// When methodArgs are passed to withBlockFilter (e.g., isIn takes 'minecraft:logs'), 'is' only needs filterArgs:
builder.withBlockFilter("isIn", "minecraft:logs").is(true);

// When methodArgs are passed directly to 'is' (e.g., for `getId` if it needed args, or for advanced scenarios):
builder.withBlockFilter("getId").is(["method_args"], ["EQUALS", "minecraft:stone"]);

methods.name: equals
methods.description: Checks if the current string filter's value is equal to any of the provided values. Can take multiple arguments for OR logic.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: One or more strings to compare against.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the current string filter's value contains any of the provided substrings. Can take multiple arguments for OR logic.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: One or more substrings to check for.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Creates a `WorldScanner` instance with the configured filters.
examples:
const scanner = builder.build();
const results = scanner.scanChunksAroundPlayer(2);
